means: [地]金属等（在压力作用下）变形

word_mean: 变形，畸形：畸形学上指一种结构缺陷，特点为非破坏性机械力引起部分身体的异形或异位
变形性：形状或形态上的适应过程，如红细胞的形状在通过毛细血管时发生变化
物体在外来因素作用下产生的形状和尺寸的改变。

sentence.Network_en: Changing stresses bring about more cracking and rock deformation.
sentence.Network_cn: 不断变化的应力导致更多的断裂和岩石变形。
通常，巨大的变形是不正常的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin deformatio(n-), from the verb deformare (see deform)

entry.tran: （使）变形;（使）成畸形;损毁…的外形
entry.def: If something deforms a person's body or something else, it causes it to have an unnatural shape. In technical English, you can also say that the second thing deforms.

example.tran: 严重的类风湿性关节炎会造成四肢变形。

example.ex: ...the ability of a metal to deform to a new shape without cracking.
example.tran: 金属重新塑形而不断裂的能力

means.word_mean: 2. alteration in the shape or dimensions of an object as a result of the application of stress to it
3. the act of twisting or deforming the shape of something (e.g., yourself)

auth_sentence.content: The cutting-edge system relies on a phenomenon called cluster deformation.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The cutting-edge system relies on a phenomenon called cluster deformation.

auth_sentence.content: This is 'elastic strain'; deformation that goes away when the load does.

sentences.en: a slow longitudinal movement or deformation
